intro: Alvaradoa amorphoides subsp. psilophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alvaradoa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
